name: Reborn (itch) (Tonz Guy)
description:
Reborn is a small game about holding into the little light that we may have and build upon it in order to overcome the darkness. 

NOTE: This is a game that entirely depends on the brightness, and not all monitors are equal. You should NOT see the path if there are no lights. If you see it, I recommend lowering your brightness to enjoy the game as it should be.

Made in 3 days for the Mini Jam 103: Darkness

Mini jam is a 72-hour-long, game development jam for independent game developers that occurs every two weeks. The limitation in this opportunity was "You are your own enemy"

Rules

The idea of the game is to connect all the light beacons to the middle of the world. It is completely dark, but you have a limited amount of light within you. You can release that light to see the path ahead. 

However, doing this will kill you (This is my interpretation of the limitation, which is "You are your own enemy". You have to harm and kill yourself in order to succeed). 

The game is kind of a roguelike in this sense. You will die a lot, but you will keep the knowledge of how the map is connected in your head for the future runs. Try to use this for your advantage.

Controls

Move using the ARROW KEYS  (or WSAD).  Use Z to interact with the world and turn the lights on.

Music

Gathering Darkness Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
